results.title: Playful Pluto [silent] [edited version]
results.creator_credit: Joseph Schenck and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon starring Mickey Mouse and Pluto. A series of wacky slapstick comedy scenes as Pluto leads Mickey from one catastrophe to the next, all stemming from a fight with the hose in the backyard.

results.title: Players
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated satire on aggression. Two characters, who look like two famous tennis players play a game of tennis which gradually develops into a battle. (Award: Special Jury Prize, Montreal World Film Festival, 1982)

results.title: Playboy number one
results.brief_description: Off-beat comedy, set aboard a cruise ship, revolving around a french teacher (Willie Howard), and his attempt to find a girlfriend. Cast includes Janet Reade, Louis Sorin, Ruth Leavitt, Charles Slattery, Abe Bronson, Joseph De Villard.

results.title: Play rugby series. No. 10. [Team play]
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the techniques of good team play for a successful, winning, try-scoring team. Rugby football is a hard physical contact game and players need to act within the ethics and rules of the game, but also must be prepared to take risks within the rules of the game.

results.title: Play on words: the provision of ESL in schools
results.creator_credit: Carole Sklan, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: The ESL child will learn faster if language is purposeful and whole in the sense that it conveys meaning. And if able speakers of English join in these activities, then the ESL learner’s progress is likely to be even faster.

results.title: Play is the work of young children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Crommie, Karen Crommie and Crommie and Crommie
results.brief_description: Lenore Wilson discusses her educational philosophy as she is shown working with children in groups and individually. Classroom scenes show the children working on a building project, moving freely around the room and acting out adult roles in their play.

results.title: Play in the snow
results.brief_description: Teaches good health habits and encourages wholesome social relationships by depicting the activities of three small children on several cold, winter days in a New England town. The children build a snowman, make snowballs and go coasting and skiing. In all these activities the children practice rules of safety and good sportsmanship.

results.title: Platypus: World's strangest animal
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Elizabeth Parer-Cook, ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: Wildlife cinematographers David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook have created, with the help of research scientists, a rare glimpse into the predominantly underwater and underground world of the strangest of animals - the platypus. Filmed in the wilderness of Tasmania, learn about the habits and habitats of this wonderful creature - with a bill, webbed feet, venomous claw and egg laying ability. Actual footage of infant platypus occupying the nest/burrow and shows the care the mother gives her young. Narrated by Peter Thompson. Special feature also available on this disc is a documentary “Bobby and the Banded Stilts” (exec. prod. Dione Gilmour, 28 min, 1997) about birdlife in Western Australia, narrated by Hugo Weaving.

results.title: Plastics and fibreglass: thermoplastics
results.creator_credit: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of the strip heater for bending acrylic sheet. The actions cover various machine tools for cutting plastic sheet, the making of jigs, cutting, planing, filing, buffing and polishing operations. Cementing pieces together. Techniques are then applied to making a project.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
